required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: (PEEK) Housing Verses Metallic Housing of Ball and Socket Attachment on Retention of Mandibular Overdenture
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Polyether Ether Ketone (PEEK) Housing Verses Metallic Housing of Ball and Socket Attachment on Retention of Mandibular Implant Retained Overdentures: Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare the clinical effect of PEEK housing vs. metal housing in terms of retention and patient satisfaction

primary_outcome.measure: Retention of implant supported overdenture by using digital force meter device

arm_group.description: metal housing of ball and socket attachment the intervention will be overdenture
Peek housing of ball and socket attachment the intervention will be overdenture

intervention.description: Active comparator will be metal housing and peek housing

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patient should be free from any systemic disease that may interfere with dental implants placement and/or osseointegration e.g. uncontrolled diabetes, hypertension, blood diseases, bone diseases, smoking.etc.
2. Patients have completely edentulous upper and lower arches.
3. Patients have healthy mucosa free from any ulceration, inflammation or infections.
4. All patients are free from neuromuscular and temporomandibular joint disorders.
5. Selected patients have normal maxillo-mandibular relationship (Angle class I ridge classification) with adequate inter-arch space and normal tongue size.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with limited manual dexterity.
2. Patients with Xerostomia, excessive salivation or pathological mucosal changes (e.g. Lichen planus, Leukoplakiaâ€¦etc.)
3. Pregnant females.
4. Un co-operative patients.
